item.name: Message Text
item.description: Specify the message. The message text must be in the form of a Javascript expression, which means that text must be enclosed in single quotes. For example: 'Weather is perfect.' This example shows a message that contains a variable: 'Please call met at' + userPhoneNumber. You can call a Javascript function to define the message text. For example, specify this as the message text: myJsMsgTextFunction()

item.name: Send To Phone Number(s)
item.description: Specify the phone number(s) to send SMS to. The text must be in the form of a Javascript expression, which means that text must be enclosed in single quotes. Multple numbers are supported by separating the numbers with a comma, example '617-222-1111, 508-123-4444'. You can call a Javascript function to define the phone numbers as a string of text. For example, specify this as the phone number(s): myJsPhoneNumFunction()
